title: Citi Named Southeast Asia Financial Adviser of the Year by FT's Mergermarket
summary: Citi was named best Southeast Asia financial advisor for 2012 in the annual awards from the FT's Mergermarket Group. The award is for advisory services to institutional clients covering mergers and acquisitions (M&A).
tag-1: Citi Named Southeast Asia Financial Adviser of the Year by FT's Mergermarket
tag-2: Citi was named best Southeast Asia financial advisor for 2012 in the annual awards from the FT's Mergermarket Group. The award is for advisory services to institutional clients covering mergers and acquisitions (M&A).
tag-3: The winners were selected with data from Mergermarket Group's M&A deal flow data, mandates and valuations intelligence provider. The data was then used to rank financial advisers according to announced deals during the qualifying period.
tag-4: "The Southeast Asia region is home to a growing base of emerging corporate champions who want access to capital and advisory services to support their global ambitions. We have been in the middle of these trends supporting our clients in this region. This award is important recognition for the team, and I would also like to thank our clients for the trust they place in Citi to provide them with market leading solutions to meet their evolving needs," said Michael Zink, Citi's Asean CEO.
tag-5: In 2012 Citi advised on close to US$20bn of M&A in the Southeast Asia region and helped clients raise more than US$25 billion from capital markets, according to the bank's data.
tag-6: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citigroup provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
